articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: It was not immediately clear if the hostage rescue and the deadly Israeli assault were part of the same operation but both took place in al-Nuseirat, an often embattled area in the eight-month-old war between Israel and Gaza's ruling Hamas.
articles.title: Israel rescues four hostages in Gaza; Palestinians say 50 dead in Israeli assault

articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: Voters in 21 EU countries including France and Germany will conclude a four-day election for the European Parliament on Sunday, which is expected to shift the assembly to the right and boost the numbers of eurosceptic nationalists.
articles.title: European Parliament poised for rightward shift after final voting

articles.author: Ted Hesson
articles.description: Biden's policy generally bars migrants who illegally cross the border from claiming asylum. There are exceptions for unaccompanied minors, people who face serious medical or safety threats, and victims of trafficking.
articles.title: Migrant arrests drop at US-Mexico border as Biden asylum ban rolls out

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hours after being rescued from eight months captivity in Gaza, freed hostage Noa Argamani arrived at a hospital in Tel Aviv to see her terminally ill mother.
articles.title: Israeli hostage Noa Argamani freed in time to see her terminally ill mother

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: North Korea has resumed sending balloons carrying trash over the border to South Korea, officials and news reports said on Sunday, a week after it vowed to continue if anti-North Korea leaflets are flown from the South.
articles.title: North Korea resumes sending trash balloons to South Korea

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Michel Rose
articles.description: Fresh from commemorating the 80th anniversary of D-Day, French President Emmanuel Macron will host U.S. President Joe Biden on Saturday for a state visit marked by pomp and a parade as well as talks on trade, Israel and Ukraine.
articles.title: Biden, Macron to discuss Israel and Ukraine in pomp-filled state visit

articles.author: Stoyan Nenov
articles.description: Bulgarians head to the polls on Sunday for their sixth parliamentary election in three years, but analysts say the vote is unlikely to yield a stable government that can end prolonged political instability and unblock economic reforms.
articles.title: Bulgaria holds another snap election, with more instability seen ahead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Radio Metronome did not detail the cause of the hospitalization.
articles.title: Haiti's interim PM hospitalized, in stable condition, local media says

articles.author: Padraic Halpin
articles.description: Sinn Fein, the former political wing of the IRA, saw a three-year lead in opinion polls almost disappear recently as more voters came to see immigration as their top concern rather than affordable housing.
articles.title: Irish coalition parties set to trounce Sinn Fein in local elections

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea will begin on Sunday loudspeaker broadcasts at the border directed at North Korea in response to the resumption of balloons carrying trash being launched by Pyongyang, the South's National Security Council said in a statement.
articles.title: South Korea to begin loudspeaker broadcasts directed at North Korea
